result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Tyler Buske

defendant.name: Buske, Brandon Tyler
defendant.address: W57 N517 Hilbert Ave. Apt 14, Cedarburg, WI 53012

records.addlTxt: 22R 010669  Bond posted at Sheriff's Dept on 10/13/2022.

Clerk was informed Atty. Steinle's office was attempting to file a motion re: huber on incorrect case. The motion they need to file is for a B3 case. Therefore, clerk removed the 10/20 motion date and notified the DA.

Clerk rejected Motion to Allow Huber Privileges filed by Atty Steinle due to motion not having hearing date and time listed.
11:01 AM Clerk rejected Motion to Allow Huber Privileges filed by Atty Steinle due to document having incorrect case number listed.
Amended bail form emailed to Sheriff's Dept.

BOND AMOUNT REDUCED TO $4000 - Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia No contact with: "S", direct or indirect at person at their residence, cannot go to address-1563 Harris Drive, Apt 7, Port Washington. Must remain 1000 ft from victim or her residence except to travel to Ozaukee Co Justice Center in Port Washington. CONDITION AMENDED: Must have scram installed if released from custody, must be able to have scram installed same day.

1:19 PM Defendant in Court on video from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Michael Steinle. Atty. Kristian Lindo appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Steinle motion for bail modification. Atty. Steinle stated defendant has about 50 days to serve yet on another sentence. DA response -no contact with victim. Court amends bail to $4000 with conditions. Plea of not guilty entered.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia No contact with: "S", direct or indirect at person at their residence, cannot go to address-1563 Harris Drive, Apt 7, Port Washington. Must remain 1000 ft from victim or her residence.

Judge Williams sitting for Judge Malloy -1:19 PM Defendant Brandon Tyler Buske appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran, appearing as friend of the Court. Atty. Kerra Stumbris appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court finds probable cause. State recommends $10,000 cash. Court is informed there is a probation hold on defendant. Court orders $7500 w/conditions. Defendant will retain counsel.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
